definition: to abandon/to desert/to renounce
the back of a body or object/to turn one's back/to hide something from/to learn by heart/to recite from memory/unlucky (slang)/hard of hearing
to be burdened/to carry on the back or shoulder
to abandon/to relinquish/to discard/to throw away

sentences.english: Never desert a group to which you owe your support.
sentences.chinese: 不要背棄自己必須盡義務支持的團體。

sentences.english: You haudio-videoe no grounds for backing up out of the contract.
sentences.chinese: 你們沒有梗直理由背棄合同。

sentences.english: On the contray, his dependent line of diplomacy of abandoning the national interest is the fundamental cause of the failure in diplomacy.
sentences.chinese: 他背棄國家民族利益的依賴主義外交路線是根本原因。

sentences.english: Then those deserters must be with them.
sentences.chinese: 然後那些背棄者一定和他們在一起。

sentences.english: If any turn back after this, they are perverted transgressors.
sentences.chinese: 此後，凡背棄約言的，都是罪人。

sentences.english: As members of the Family of Light, you are renegades.
sentences.chinese: 作爲光家族成員，你們是背棄的。

sentences.english: The government has been charged with reneging on the promises that it made to the voters during the election.
sentences.chinese: 政府背棄了在選舉時向選民所作的承諾而遭到指責。

sentences.english: The Government are back-pedalling on their election promises.
sentences.chinese: 內閣正在背棄它競選時的諾言。

sentences.english: Being captivated by shadow, how many people have betrayed divinity and warmness?
sentences.chinese: 被陰影魅惑，有多少人背棄了神性與溫存？

sentences.english: I will not violate my covenant or alter what my lips have uttered.
sentences.chinese: 我必不背棄我的約，也不改變我口中所出的。

sentences.english: Friends that desert us in the hour of need are friends in name, chaussures louboutin, not in reality.
sentences.chinese: 在堅苦時辰背棄我們的是名存實亡的同夥。

sentences.english: All his friends have deserter him when he is in difficulties.
sentences.chinese: 在他困難的時候，他所有的朋友都背棄了他。

sentences.english: These tyrannies are all the direct result of the abandonment of Biblical Christianity.
sentences.chinese: 這些專橫都是背棄聖經基督教教義的直接後果。

sentences.english: When faced with a choice, don't betray your loving Leader.
sentences.chinese: 面臨抉擇時，切莫背棄愛你的主。

sentences.english: So they went back on their statement.
sentences.chinese: 於是他們背棄了原來的聲明。

definition: to abandon
to run in the opposite direction (idiom); to run counter to
variant of 抵觸|抵触[di3 chu4]
to conspire
to follow blindly (idiom)/to take as one's only guide
to turn a blind eye to
to delay
authentic
to watch with folded arms (idiom); to look on without lifting a finger
to go against/to be contrary to/to violate
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to keep on saying (idiom); to repeat over and over again
contempt/contemptuous/to despise/to scorn/scornful
to depart from/to deviate from/deviation
misconception/fallacy
promise
